title: Over/Under Rated masteries.
body:
So basically i am making this topic to talk about some masteries that i personally think are over or under rated currently.

First there is one that i will mention that isn't either, and that's Warlord's Blood lust, unfortunately due to certain champs being able to abuse this, this mastery got gutted, however on those crit based ADC's it's still a decent Mastery.

Underrated: Fervor of battle, honestly since the change i feel this keystone is super under rated, now the main reason it got nerfed is because Guinsoo's + this was just dealing stupid damage, however with the changes, it's better on champs that can get off 1/2 spells and then do a few autos (Someone like Zed.)

Overrated: Deathfire Touch, unfortunately this spell is just overrated as it is a shit keystone, the "buff" to duration just ended up being an overall nerf to the damage it puts out (because the base wasn't increased just the duration over which it's applied, so it was a nerf) and unfortunately this spell forces you to minimize trading to get the most of this keystone, even someone like brand uses thunderlord's better.

Thunderlord's, unfortunately this just needs to be nerfed, i took this on brand because of how stupidly strong this is.

Overrated/Underrated: Merciless/Meditation, so in this line most people will run merciless (more damage below 40% health) however i think this is overrated, and it's shared line mastery is underrated, basically, meditation gives 1.5% of your missing mana every 5 seconds, to put this into context, this is 45 mana from a depleted 300 mana pool, with this on, and a mana item part, you will basically never run out of mana in lane.

Overrated: Bond of stone, speaks for itself honestly, i feel this is just an over rated tank support mastery that is out classed by just doing your job and peeling.

Underrated: Grasp of the Undying, this keystone is severely underrated, and mostly due to a lack of understanding of how strong it is, you can keep yourself in combat with minions and then get this off every 4 seconds and slowly take your opponent down and on a tank, this just becomes brutal, a 3k health tank (enough health to proc Warmog's passive) will be stealing 90 health every proc, now this may seem small, but considering you should live long enough to get 3+ procs of this off, and generally have damage in your kit anyway, this is actually stronger then people give it credit for.

Underrated: Runic Armor, the amount of times this isn't ran with a soraka on the team is just horrid, run this with soraka and her heals will be stupid.

Over/Underrated: Double edged sword/Feast, honestly i think Double Edged Sword is slightly overrated compared to the survivability that comes with feast, sure it's on a 25 second cooldown, but it's still fairly decent in a close lane as you will slowly out sustain your opponent.

replies.body: When the Keystone Masteries came out, I took Fervor of Battle on zed for a while, but then I realised it was nothing compared to ThunderLord's Decree, especially in the laning phase. I could make the enemy have to recall just from 1 combo of w+e+q. OP OP
I'm talking about the current iteration, where you stack mostly from abilitys, Zed would be able to fully stack this in a combo, and go in for one smack that will hurt.
but you need to autoattack to stack it up. When I play zed the enemy die before I can barely autoattack
"damaging enemy champions with an ability generates 2 stacks of fervor"

I think Vampirisim is super underrated. 2% life steal is really nice in the laning phase, way better than +10 AD level 18.
Also Strength of Ages is underrated as well, especially in the jungle.

I didn't think anyone ran the Natural Talent Mastery, but if it's used then i would say your right.

As for Strength of Ages, i'd say it's probably right where it should be, i mean sure 300 health is nice, but i dunno, i feel like there are better things to be running in the jungle depending on your use of jungler.

I think people underestimate how quickly it can be charged in the jungle. Two full clears and a few scuttle crabs will max you out to 300 health. That's actually insane, because most champions will cap in less than 7 min, and even less if you get some counter jungle or cannon minion tax. 

The power spike is even bigger if you get Cinderhulk. Since that makes your 300 health go even further.

I just feel it's underwhelming, it's basically, you get 300 health, and then your Keystone is useless.

And yeah i realize you can probably get it by 6, that doesn't really necessarily make it good.

Maybe you're right, I still think you're looking at it from a lane perspective where you have gold coming out your ass. But for my 2 mains, jungle and support, I take what I can get and 300 free health is fucking crazy XD

For jungle, i feel one of the other Keystones is nearly always going to be better (Thunderlords, Grasp of the Undying for the damage/tank) because both of these actually scale into the game, and have tremendous impact while ganking.

For support, if your a tank support i feel Bond of Stone is better free stats as your getting a % damage reduction on damage taken.

Honestly 300 health stops scaling really quick, and your taking 800 gold worth of stats and making them your keystone, instead of things that can actually help in other areas as well as giving you stats.
masteries are overrated just look for cute numbers @ lvl 1/pages
Honestly considering it's meta to have at least 4 thunderlord's per team, i don't think it's underrated at all.
